newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Nov 6.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Nov 6.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
The Reserve Bank of Australia cut official cash interest rates by 0.5 basis points to 6.5 percent early on Tuesday.

James Hardie Industries Ltd said on Tuesday the total after tax provision for its exposure to Firmandale Investments Ltd had risen by A$1.2 million to A$65 million. This was due to a further decline in Firmandale's net asset value based on its final accounts for the year ended March 31, it said.

Petroleum Securities Ltd (PetSec) said it made a net profit for the first quarter of the year to June 30, 1996 of A$12.58 million, which represented further strong profit growth. It said its operating profit before interest, tax and abnormal items was A$7.64 million for the quarter.

Former Suncorp chairman Graham Tucker and his former deputy Ted Ranson have resigned as Bank of Queensland directors ahead of the bank's annual meeting next month, the Courier-Mail newspaper reported on Wednesday.
Malaysia's Berjaya Group Bhd said on Tuesday its wholly-owned subsidiary has acquired 13.0 million shares or a 12.52 percent equity stake in Australia's Alpha Healthcare Ltd for A$2.17 million.

CP Ventures Ltd said on Wednesday it had not yet considered a buy-out offer from fellow investment group Innerhadden Ltd. Directors recommended that sharehoholders wait for formal advice in its Part B response statement, which would be accompanied by an independent expert's report.
